name: Indian Institute of Technology Palakkad
overview: One of the newer IITs established in 2015, rapidly growing its permanent campus near the Western Ghats. It focuses on interdisciplinary research and core engineering.

name: Indian Institute of Management Kozhikode
overview: A premier management institute situated on two hillocks in the Kunnamangalam area. It is one of the fastest-growing IIMs, known for its Globalizing Indian Thought mission.

name: National Institute of Technology Calicut
overview: Formerly REC Calicut, this is one of the top NITs in India. It hosts a dedicated School of Management Studies and a School of Architecture alongside engineering.

name: Indian Institute of Science Education and Research Thiruvananthapuram
overview: A premier institute dedicated to basic sciences research and education, located in the foothills of the Western Ghats.

name: Indian Institute of Space Science and Technology
overview: Asia's first Space University established by the Department of Space, Govt. of India. It functions as an autonomous body under DOS and is closely linked with ISRO.
tuition: Zero (Fully funded upon meeting GPA criteria)

name: Sree Chitra Tirunal Institute for Medical Sciences and Technology
overview: An Institute of National Importance offering super-specialty medical training and biomedical engineering research.

name: Central University of Kerala
overview: Established to improve access to quality higher education in Northern Kerala. It operates from a scenic campus in Tejaswini Hills.

name: University of Kerala
overview: One of the first 16 universities in India. It affiliates colleges in Thiruvananthapuram, Kollam, Alappuzha, and Pathanamthitta districts.

name: Cochin University of Science and Technology
overview: A government-owned autonomous science and technology university known for its B.Tech (School of Engineering), Marine Sciences, and Law programs.

name: Mahatma Gandhi University
overview: A major affiliating university in Central Kerala known for its strong research output in polymer science and environmental studies.

name: University of Calicut
overview: The largest university in Kerala in terms of affiliated colleges and student intake, serving the northern districts.

name: Kannur University
overview: A multi-campus university serving the Kannur, Kasaragod, and Wayanad districts.

name: APJ Abdul Kalam Technological University
overview: The affiliating university for nearly all engineering, architecture, and management colleges in Kerala.

name: Kerala University of Health Sciences
overview: A dedicated state university for medical, dental, nursing, pharmacy, and paramedical education in Kerala.

name: Kerala Agricultural University
overview: The primary state university for agriculture, forestry, and agricultural engineering.

name: National University of Advanced Legal Studies
overview: The only National Law University (NLU) in Kerala, providing integrated legal education.

name: College of Engineering Trivandrum
overview: The first engineering college in Kerala, established in 1939. It is the most sought-after college under KEAM counselling.

name: Government Medical College, Thiruvananthapuram
overview: The oldest and most prestigious medical college in Kerala, attached to a tertiary care hospital.

name: Government Medical College, Kozhikode
overview: A premier government medical institution serving the northern districts of Kerala.

name: Amrita Vishwa Vidyapeetham
overview: A multi-campus, multi-disciplinary Institute of Eminence (IoE) and Deemed University. The Kochi campus houses the famous Amrita Institute of Medical Sciences (AIMS).

name: University College, Thiruvananthapuram
overview: A heritage institution and constituent college of the University of Kerala, consistently ranked high in NIRF for colleges.

name: Sacred Heart College, Thevara
overview: A premier autonomous arts and science college in Kochi, affiliated with MG University, known for its scenic backwater campus.

name: Rajagiri School of Engineering & Technology
overview: A leading private autonomous engineering college in Kochi, located in the Rajagiri Valley near InfoPark.

name: Thangal Kunju Musaliar College of Engineering
overview: The first government-aided engineering college in Kerala. It is highly prestigious and operates with academic autonomy.

name: Kerala Kalamandalam
overview: A Deemed University for Art and Culture, founded by Vallathol Narayana Menon to preserve Kathakali and other classical arts.

name: Thunchath Ezhuthachan Malayalam University
overview: Dedicated to the study and research of Malayalam language, literature, and culture.

name: Chinmaya Vishwavidyapeeth
overview: A deemed university integrating Indian knowledge systems with contemporary education.

name: Government Model Engineering College
overview: Run by IHRD, this is one of the top engineering colleges in the state, famous for its high placement records.

name: St. Teresa's College
overview: A prestigious autonomous women's college in Kochi, affiliated with MG University.

name: Farook College
overview: The largest autonomous postgraduate institution under the University of Calicut, with a strong history of minority education.

name: Kerala University of Fisheries and Ocean Studies
overview: The first fisheries university in India, dedicated to studies in fisheries and ocean sciences.

name: Kerala Veterinary and Animal Sciences University
overview: A state university established to promote education and research in veterinary and animal sciences.

name: National Institute of Technology Calicut
overview: NIRF Ranked Engineering Institute

name: Government Engineering College Thrissur
overview: NIRF Ranked Engineering Institute
